main(String[]) - Static method in class Main
Runs the game
Main - Class in <Unnamed>
The main method, runs the game
Main() - Constructor for class Main
 
manhattanDistance(Coordinate, Coordinate) - Method in class BotPlayer
Takes in the bot's and human's coordinates and returns the manhattan distance between them.
manhattanSearch(HashMap<String, Coordinate>, ArrayList<Coordinate>) - Method in class BotPlayer
Loops through each of the valid directions and checks through all the humans on the cropped map for the manhattan distance from them, then returns the move which gets the bot closest to a human.
map - Variable in class GameLogic
Represents the map of the game
map - Variable in class Map
ArrayList of strings which represents the maps.
Map - Class in <Unnamed>
This class contains the map information, including the map name, gold required to win, and the map structure.
Map(int) - Constructor for class Map
The constructor receives the minimum number of spaces the map should accomodate for (for placing bots and players)
MapException - Exception in <Unnamed>
A class which creates objects of exception type which help identify different types of errors loading in the maps Accomodates for adding a useful message to direct towards the error.
MapException(String) - Constructor for exception MapException
Passes on a message about an error with a map
mapName - Variable in class Map
String representing the map name
maxArgNum - Variable in class Command

maxMoveWithoutLook - Variable in class BotPlayer
Integer representing the maximum number of moves the bot should make before looking
minArgNum - Variable in class Command

minimumRequiredNumOfSpaces - Variable in class Map
Integer representing the minimum number of spawnable spaces the map should contain
move(List<String>) - Method in class GameLogic
Receives a list of arguments (of length 1) and tries to move the player in the corresponding direction they asked
moveDirection() - Method in class BotPlayer
Decides whether the bot should do a manhattan search or move randomly based on whether a human is visible or not, and then return the move decided upon using the method decided
moveWithoutLook - Variable in class BotPlayer
Integer representing the number of moves the bot has done without looking
